channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3556] How to Suck at Facebook - The Oatmeal
item.description: A comic depicting the 9 worst types of facebook users.

item.title: [+2586] Irrelephant (PIC)
[+2278] Entering Apple Restriction Zone
[+2274] J.D. Salinger has died at 91
item.description: Son says J.D. Salinger, author of 'Catcher in the Rye,' has died at age 91.

item.title: [+2154] iPad DRM: a huge step backwards in the history of computing
item.description: The Defective by Design team ran a protest outside today's Apple event. Why? Because the iPad's unprecedented use of DRM to control all capabilities of a general purpose computer is a dangerous step backward for computing and media distribution. Sign the petition!

item.title: [+1680] Reporter Makes Improbable Shot, Goofy Expression [Video]
item.description: While describing the story of the high school teacher who made an improbable half court shot while blindfolded, a reporter made a similarly improbable shot. However, it is clouded by the inexplicably goofy expression on his face afterwards. Anyone thing this shot looks a tad fishy? Just saying...

item.title: [+1477] Could Mega Shark really take down a plane? (INFOGRAPHIC)
[+1312] 10 Things Netbooks still do better than an iPad
item.description: The iPad is Apple's bold answer to the Netbook, but that doesn't mean it can replace all ultraportables (yet).

item.title: [+1131] You Better Shape Up (COMIC)
item.description: Push the Red Button, win an iPad. Just kidding.

item.title: [+998] Poll: 83% Approve of Obama's State of the Union Proposals
item.description: CBS News/Knowledge Networks Poll Gathers Immediate Reaction to Obama's Speech.

item.title: [+920] The Tale of Two Brothers [Pic]
item.description: One Dedicated Gamer, One Sell Out

item.title: [+818] Scientists Answer: Are Liberals Smarter Than Conservatives?
item.description: What if we could know, scientifically, that one side has the edge in brainpower? Should that change how we think about political issues?

item.title: [+797] Instant Apple iPad Reaction: Disappointment
item.description: Dan Lyons emails from the iPad unveiling: "I haven't been this let down since Snooki hooked up with The Situation."

item.title: [+739] The Apple iPad Dilemma
item.description: Steve Jobs called the new iPad a "magical device". Execs from the company said it so often that I began to imagine pixie-dust falling from the ceiling of the Yerba Buena Art Center, landing gently on our throbbing skulls and slowly but surely lulling us into the belief that Jobs and co had, in fact, introduced something otherworldly.

item.title: [+734] .....wait for it....wait for it (PIC)
item.description: ♫ ♪ ♪ Catch a little fly and put it in your gullet....

item.title: [+672] 25 Funny Tombstones (PICS)
[+645] Obama to push for 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell' repeal in SOTU
item.description: President Barack Obama will ask Congress to repeal the military's "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy during his State of the Union address on Wednesday night, news reports say.

item.title: [+638] 19 Roads that you definitely DON'T want to drive on (PICS)
item.description: Here is the list of the world’s most complicated and dangerous roads. Some of these complicated mountain passes can be dangerous if not negotiated with utmost caution, while others are complicated sets of roads and bridges, erected to ensure a streamlined flow of traffic at busy junctions. Without further ado, we present our top 19 list…

item.title: [+638] Apple Lifts Ban on iPhone Apps Making VoIP Calls Over 3G
item.description: In an update to its iPhone SDK, Apple is now permitting apps to make VoIP calls over 3G wireless networks, an option that was once only available over a WiFi connection.

item.title: [+634] GoldenEye: Source Beta 4 Trailer (Video)
item.description: Source's Half-Life 2 mod which recreates the classic '97 game GoldenEye 007. The Beta 4 version is coming soon.
